body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#25943](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25943) (rpc: Add a parameter to sendrawtransaction which sets a maximum burned output for OP_RETURN transactions. by davidgumberg)
* [#25939](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25939) (rpc: In `utxoupdatepsbt` also look for the tx in the txindex by ishaanam)
* [#25796](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25796) (rpc: add `descriptorprocesspsbt` rpc by ishaanam)
* [#25747](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25747) (rpc: add ability to export/import descriptor files in `listdescriptors` and `importdescriptors` by w0xlt)
* [#25737](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25737) (rpc: remove redundant univalue type checks by furszy)
* [#25429](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25429) (refactor: Avoid UniValue copies by MarcoFalke)
* [#25366](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25366) (util, rpc: Add parameter to `deriveaddresses` to display address information by w0xlt)
* [#25344](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25344) (New `outputs` argument for `bumpfee`/`psbtbumpfee` by rodentrabies)
* [#25093](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25093) (rpc: Check for omitted, but required parameters by MarcoFalke)
* [#24162](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24162) (rpc: add require_checksum flag to deriveaddresses by kallewoof)
* [#23319](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23319) (rpc: Return fee and prevout (utxos) to getrawtransaction by dougEfresh)
* [#21283](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21283) (Implement BIP 370 PSBTv2 by achow101)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Is this something that I can help out on? I'm looking for another task. I don't know of the etiquette of hoping on a drafted pull request.
